alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 08 at 1:03AM EDT until October 08 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... East Branch Ausable River At Ausable Forks affecting Essex and Clinton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Ausable River at Ausable Forks. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, In Jay, water will cover Route 9N near Trumbulls Corner. Minor flooding can occur in Keene. Water begins to overflow onto Hulls Falls Road, Route 73, and Route 9N near Marcy Field. High water will impact interests at Alice Falls near Keeseville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:51 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.9 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM EDT.
